sub_title: Local support for internationals, Dutch language training & expat wellbeing. Assisting both employers and employees.
summary:
My relocation advice and Dutch language training programmes make it easier for internationals and expat employees to feel at home in the Netherlands and to understand the locals. To discuss your personal/company needs, please contact me by phone: +31 (0)6 497 68 628 or email: monique@amstelexpats.nl

As Relocation Specialist, I support internationals completing their relocation tasks, such as: registration, BSN, find a home, organise utilities, school search and open a bank account. I help them settle-in smoothly by making a personal relocation assessment, solving specific issues and recommending local service providers. 

As Dutch Language Trainer, my goal is to help internationals getting to grips with the Dutch language without any stress and anxiety. Having lots of relocation expertise and local knowledge ensures that lessons are both fun and informative. Teaching adults in small groups creates an open atmosphere and encourages interaction amongst participants. I specially developed the Boost Your Dutch course to accelerate learning Dutch as a second language.

I offer the following Dutch language activities:
	Boost Your Dutch short courses (complete overview of Dutch basics in 3 x 2½ hours)
	Weekly Dutch classes (15 lessons at beginner’s & intermediate levels)
	Local Coffee Mornings to practice your Dutch in an informal setting

Over the years, I gained many insights into the communication and adjustment problems of internationals. In my view, Expat Wellbeing is one of the key elements to ensure that internationals remain for their intended stay. Since 2017 I am involved in developing the Expat Wellbeing Indicator, which is an online tool for local authorities to determine their level of attractiveness for international residents. A free demo is available for interested parties, such as local authorities and Expat Centers.

Please contact me with your queries.
Phone: +31 (0)6 497 68 628
Email: monique@amstelexpats.nl
or visit the website: www.amstelexpats.nl

treasury_media.title: Fun, Fast, Interactive, Friendly Atmosphere, Native Insights & International MindSet .png
treasury_media.description: Give yourself a head start learning Dutch through this new and innovative new approach. It does not matter if you have lived in the Netherlands for a couple of months, a couple of years or maybe even 10+ years. It is never too late to learn Dutch!

treasury_media.title: Making life easier for internationals living in the Netherlands.png
treasury_media.description: As Relocation Specialist, I help internationals and expat employees with a wide range of practical issues to ensure they feel welcome and cared for during their transition period.

publications.name: Boost Your Dutch, The Approach: Principles, Examples & Exercises

authors.headline: Local support for internationals, Dutch language training & expat wellbeing. Assisting both employers and employees.

profile_positions.description:
Providing practical help and guidance for expats, their families and employers in the Amsterdam region. With my local knowledge and expertise, I help expats deal with Dutch formalities and common practices. Amstel Expats also provides advice and information on reliable local businesses, housing agents, utility companies, international & local schools, etc.

To make it easier for internationals to feel at home & understand the locals, I developed the Boost Your Dutch Training Programme. This new and innovative method accelerates the learning process and provides a no-stress, friendly atmosphere for learning Dutch as a second language.

Local support packages and Dutch language training programmes are also offered to employers. Employee-packages can be tailored to suit specific company needs and budget. 

After moving back to my home country as the partner of an expat, I acquired hands-on experience with settling in under expat circumstances. Before assisting expats professionally, I worked as a consultant and project manager in the Netherlands and abroad. London was my home for about 5 years and I also carried out international assignments in the USA, Canada and Europe.
profile_positions.title: Relocation Specialist & Dutch Language Trainer

profile_positions.description:
As one of the founders, I established Expat Help, Relocation, Housing & Tax within the Amsterdam region.

My client focus was on delivering relocation and immigration services. As part of the integrated relocation packages, I also delivered housing and tax services to clients.

In my partner role, I was responsible for setting-up the company professionally, such as: managing business processing, accounting and procurement. Other areas of responsibility included: developing partner relationships and producing promotional and client materials.
profile_positions.title: Partner

profile_positions.description: Managing projects in different phases, i.e. start-up, realisation and post-evaluation. Producing organisational designs, improving business processes and implementing systems.Coaching both team members and departmental staff. As teamleader within the department also involved in projectstaffing, annual evaluations and the running of the department.
profile_positions.title: Senior Project Advisor

profile_positions.description: Responsible for the analysis and design of business processes and the functional design of supporting systems. Also included were presentations of concepts, system demonstrations and leading project teams.
profile_positions.title: Senior Consultant

profile_positions.description: Analysing the logistics and information requirements of clients. Developing a data model of the European Transportation Industry to be incorporated into the world wide model, being produced in the U.S.
profile_positions.title: Commercial Analyst
